on children with bronchiolitis were read as negative. however, there are only 3 studies in the literature reporting risk factors for radiographic abnormalities among young children with bronchiolitis7,9,10. 279 young children were admitted with bronchiolitis during the study period. the study included sex, age, presence or absence of fever, laboratory data, and previous hospitalization for respiratory illnesses. a second senior staff radiologist read the initial 279 radiographs to confirm the expert reading. nasopharyngeal aspirate specimens were collected at the time of hospitalization by carefully irrigating the young child's nostrils with sterile saline solution. total viral RNA was obtained from nasopharyngeal aspirate specimens (300 L) by utilizing Viral
